thread.title: Franklin Wine Fest expected to be a sellout
thread.title_full: Franklin Wine Fest expected to be a sellout

title: Franklin Wine Fest expected to be a sellout
text:
Franklin Wine Fest expected to be a sellout Todd Barnes , tbarnes@tennessean.com 6:31 p.m. CDT October 9, 2015 The Franklin Wine Festival will feature 400 wines from around the world, paired with food from more than 30 Middle Tennessee restaurants. (Photo: Horsche, Getty Images/iStockphoto) CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
More than 400 wines will be flowing into the glasses of those lucky to have reserved tickets for the Franklin Wine Festival, which is expected to be a sellout. 
The festival, regarded as one of Middle Tennessee's premiere wine-tasting events and held Oct. 16 at The Factory at Franklin, will feature vintages by Silver Oak Cellars, Vidal-Fleury, Rombauer, Michael David Winery and Taittinger. Festival goers will be savoring their selections by pairing them with food from some of the Midstate's finest restaurants, including Kayne Prime, Sperry’s, 1808 Grille, Moto and Sopapilla’s. 
“We were so excited to see an absolutely amazing selection of wines this year,” Penny Floyd, the event's chair, said in a media statement. “Placing 400 wines inside The Factory at Franklin really challenged the event staff, but the wines being offered were all so outstanding. We simply had to present them all to the public.” 
Although the event will be shrouded in fun, funds raised will go toward the Big Brothers Big Sisters of Middle Tennessee, a volunteer organization that pairs children with an adult mentor. 
All wines featured at the festival will be on sale a week after the event at Cool Springs Wines & Spirits. 
Tickets are $89 at franklinwinefestival.com . If tickets don't sell out before the event, they will be $100 at the door. Read or Share this story: http://tnne.ws/1LmHevs TOP VIDEOS
